revised_title: Douglas McKie: A Pioneering Historian of Science
tldr: This article is a tribute to Professor Douglas McKie, a renowned historian of science, who made significant contributions to understanding the history of 17th-century science, particularly the works of Lavoisier and Joseph Black. His expertise and passion for the subject led him to become a leading figure in the field, and he is remembered for his masterful study of the origins and foundation of the Royal Society.
